issue.title: Texts for landingspage
issue.body:
Review & add the text for the my-dao-dashboard-landingspage (visual example on bottom):

_TO REVIEW!_

**Gear up, get DAO’ing.**
In the fast-paced world of decentralized autonomous 
organizations, we need a single app to keep up to 
speed and tune in to all activity surrounding these 
instruments of decentralisation.
(link) Enter My DAO Dashboard.

•

**Participate or watch.**
Apart from the DAO’s your participating in, you can also easily add some to your watchlist and observe their activity.

**Vote in-app.**
See all active and passive proposals for each DAO, and execute the DAO’s most prominent feature, voting, directly in the app. 

**Take the pulse.**
All key-metrics of your all of your DAO’s will be visible in the app, making sure you know what’s going on in each DAO.

(button)go to My DAO Dashboard

•

These DAO-protocols will be supported in the app.
Are we missing an important one? Let us know!

•

**My DAO Dashboard**
Originated at EthBerlinZwei, My DAO Dashboard is an open source 
community, aiming to contribute value to the decentralized 
world by creating  useful tools for managing DAO’s.

(link)Wanna join? Reach out!
Find us on these platforms:
_____

_TO ADD!_

[Text about 'DAO Scan']
[Text about 'My DAO Dashboard']



_VISUAL EXAMPLE:_
![MDD_landingspage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51742196/74036413-84dd5b00-49bc-11ea-8908-aaa29e9f80f0.png)

issue.title: [BUG] DAO balance not properly calculated
issue.body:
**Describe the issue**
DAO balances are not well calculated for `0xf632Ce27Ea72deA30d30C1A9700B6b3bCeAA05cF`. The last DAO should have a balance of 252.7 DAIs.

![Screenshot from 2020-01-22 19-16-42](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/931684/72928170-cbde1600-3d57-11ea-91da-3fb2f935e0e1.png)


**Steps to Reproduce**
Go to to https://mydaodashboard.com/ and connect with `0xf632Ce27Ea72deA30d30C1A9700B6b3bCeAA05cF` account.

**Expected behavior**
It should count DAIs + SAIs on [this DAO](https://mainnet.aragon.org/#/0x8110489e2c26c7a4c6679e64a1563355135ddf11/0x2c96165c464809353f4423d30ad3ed47dd12a348/).

![Screenshot from 2020-01-22 20-45-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/931684/72928371-2aa38f80-3d58-11ea-886c-73ee9b13b1e7.png)

**Actual behavior**
It displays previous DAO balance.

Notice that beehive is shown twice because I have BEE and HONEY tokens, both tokens from the Behive DAO. Probably that DAO should be only shown once.

**Environment**

https://mydaodashboard.com/ and https://my-dao-dashboard.herokuapp.com/

**Additional data**
N/A

issue.title: Bump handlebars from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3 in /web

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3.
Changelog *Sourced from [handlebars's changelog](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/blob/master/release-notes.md).* > ## v4.5.3 - November 18th, 2019 > Bugfixes: > > - fix: add "no-prototype-builtins" eslint-rule and fix all occurences - f7f05d7 > - fix: add more properties required to be enumerable - 1988878 > > Chores / Build: > - fix: use !== 0 instead of != 0 - c02b05f > - add chai and dirty-chai and sinon, for cleaner test-assertions and spies, > deprecate old assertion-methods - 93e284e, 886ba86, 0817dad, 93516a0 > > Security: > > - The properties `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` > have been added to the list of "properties that must be enumerable". > If a property by that name is found and not enumerable on its parent, > it will silently evaluate to `undefined`. This is done in both the compiled template and the "lookup"-helper. > This will prevent new Remote-Code-Execution exploits that have been > published recently. > > Compatibility notes: > > - Due to the security-fixes. The semantics of the templates using > `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` in the respect that those expression now return > `undefined` rather than their actual value from the proto. > - The semantics have not changed in cases where the properties are enumerable, as in: > > ```js > { > __proto__: 'some string' > } > ``` > > - The change may be breaking in that respect, but we still only > increase the patch-version, because the incompatible use-cases > are not intended, undocumented and far less important than fixing > Remote-Code-Execution exploits on existing systems. > > > > [Commits](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.5.2...v4.5.3) > > ## v4.5.2 - November 13th, 2019 > # Bugfixes > > - fix: use String(field) in lookup when checking for "constructor" - d541378 > - test: add fluent API for testing Handlebars - c2ac79c > > Compatibility notes: > - no incompatibility are to be expected > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`c819c8b`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/c819c8b533934d2ac18001d7eb27a3205b00c2f3) v4.5.3 - [`827c9d0`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/827c9d0747bef7d7f89829779523b6b2dcf3051d) Update release notes - [`f7f05d7`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/f7f05d7558e674856686b62a00cde5758f3b7a08) fix: add "no-prototype-builtins" eslint-rule and fix all occurences - [`1988878`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/198887808780bbef9dba67a8af68ece091d5baa7) fix: add more properties required to be enumerable - [`886ba86`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/886ba86c2f9cc71b7d99b9018fbe2d72a57085cc) test/chore: add chai/expect and sinon to "runtime"-environment - [`0817dad`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/0817dad7e72c51d07f7700547d0c69aa79a4976b) test: add sinon as global variable to eslint in the specs - [`93516a0`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/93516a0b07026ebd23c84fddf270a0c8b570bc59) test: add sinon.js for spies, deprecate current assertions - [`93e284e`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/93e284ed9be1e38c5e6945f15af1ccd689f2ada6) chore: add chai and dirty-chai for better test assertions - [`c02b05f`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/c02b05fa819f46bb66c878bebc6e8006408ebd5c) fix: use !== 0 instead of != 0 - [`8de121d`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/8de121d21c88a6ab877e3a0eec9daaac483f3bf0) v4.5.2 - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.1.2...v4.5.3)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=handlebars&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=4.1.2&new-version=4.5.3)](https://help.github.com/articles/configuring-automated-security-fixes) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot ignore this [patch|minor|major] version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor/major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/my-dao-dashboard/My-DAO-Dashboard/network/alerts).

issue.title: Bump handlebars from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3 in /web

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3.
Changelog *Sourced from [handlebars's changelog](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/blob/master/release-notes.md).* > ## v4.5.3 - November 18th, 2019 > Bugfixes: > > - fix: add "no-prototype-builtins" eslint-rule and fix all occurences - f7f05d7 > - fix: add more properties required to be enumerable - 1988878 > > Chores / Build: > - fix: use !== 0 instead of != 0 - c02b05f > - add chai and dirty-chai and sinon, for cleaner test-assertions and spies, > deprecate old assertion-methods - 93e284e, 886ba86, 0817dad, 93516a0 > > Security: > > - The properties `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` > have been added to the list of "properties that must be enumerable". > If a property by that name is found and not enumerable on its parent, > it will silently evaluate to `undefined`. This is done in both the compiled template and the "lookup"-helper. > This will prevent new Remote-Code-Execution exploits that have been > published recently. > > Compatibility notes: > > - Due to the security-fixes. The semantics of the templates using > `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` in the respect that those expression now return > `undefined` rather than their actual value from the proto. > - The semantics have not changed in cases where the properties are enumerable, as in: > > ```js > { > __proto__: 'some string' > } > ``` > > - The change may be breaking in that respect, but we still only > increase the patch-version, because the incompatible use-cases > are not intended, undocumented and far less important than fixing > Remote-Code-Execution exploits on existing systems. > > > > [Commits](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.5.2...v4.5.3) > > ## v4.5.2 - November 13th, 2019 > # Bugfixes > > - fix: use String(field) in lookup when checking for "constructor" - d541378 > - test: add fluent API for testing Handlebars - c2ac79c > > Compatibility notes: > - no incompatibility are to be expected > ... (truncated)

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3.
Changelog *Sourced from [handlebars's changelog](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/blob/master/release-notes.md).* > ## v4.5.3 - November 18th, 2019 > Bugfixes: > > - fix: add "no-prototype-builtins" eslint-rule and fix all occurences - f7f05d7 > - fix: add more properties required to be enumerable - 1988878 > > Chores / Build: > - fix: use !== 0 instead of != 0 - c02b05f > - add chai and dirty-chai and sinon, for cleaner test-assertions and spies, > deprecate old assertion-methods - 93e284e, 886ba86, 0817dad, 93516a0 > > Security: > > - The properties `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` > have been added to the list of "properties that must be enumerable". > If a property by that name is found and not enumerable on its parent, > it will silently evaluate to `undefined`. This is done in both the compiled template and the "lookup"-helper. > This will prevent new Remote-Code-Execution exploits that have been > published recently. > > Compatibility notes: > > - Due to the security-fixes. The semantics of the templates using > `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` in the respect that those expression now return > `undefined` rather than their actual value from the proto. > - The semantics have not changed in cases where the properties are enumerable, as in: > > ```js > { > __proto__: 'some string' > } > ``` > > - The change may be breaking in that respect, but we still only > increase the patch-version, because the incompatible use-cases > are not intended, undocumented and far less important than fixing > Remote-Code-Execution exploits on existing systems. > > > > [Commits](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.5.2...v4.5.3) > > ## v4.5.2 - November 13th, 2019 > # Bugfixes > > - fix: use String(field) in lookup when checking for "constructor" - d541378 > - test: add fluent API for testing Handlebars - c2ac79c > > Compatibility notes: > - no incompatibility are to be expected > ... The semantics of the templates using > `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` in the respect that those expression now return > `undefined` rather than their actual value from the proto. > - The semantics have not changed in cases where the properties are enumerable, as in: > > ```js > { > __proto__: 'some string' > } > ``` > > - The change may be breaking in that respect, but we still only > increase the patch-version, because the incompatible use-cases > are not intended, undocumented and far less important than fixing > Remote-Code-Execution exploits on existing systems. > > > > [Commits](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.5.2...v4.5.3) > > ## v4.5.2 - November 13th, 2019 > # Bugfixes > > - fix: use String(field) in lookup when checking for "constructor" - d541378 > - test: add fluent API for testing Handlebars - c2ac79c > > Compatibility notes: > - no incompatibility are to be expected > ... issue.title: Bump handlebars from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3 in /web

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

issue.body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3.
Changelog *Sourced from [handlebars's changelog](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/blob/master/release-notes.md).* > ## v4.5.3 - November 18th, 2019 > Bugfixes: > > - fix: add "no-prototype-builtins" eslint-rule and fix all occurences - f7f05d7 > - fix: add more properties required to be enumerable - 1988878 > > Chores / Build: > - fix: use !== 0 instead of != 0 - c02b05f > - add chai and dirty-chai and sinon, for cleaner test-assertions and spies, > deprecate old assertion-methods - 93e284e, 886ba86, 0817dad, 93516a0 > > Security: > > - The properties `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` > have been added to the list of "properties that must be enumerable". > If a property by that name is found and not enumerable on its parent, > it will silently evaluate to `undefined`. This is done in both the compiled template and the "lookup"-helper. > This will prevent new Remote-Code-Execution exploits that have been > published recently. > > Compatibility notes: > > - Due to the security-fixes. The semantics of the templates using > `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` in the respect that those expression now return > `undefined` rather than their actual value from the proto. > - The semantics have not changed in cases where the properties are enumerable, as in: > > ```js > { > __proto__: 'some string' > } > ``` > > - The change may be breaking in that respect, but we still only > increase the patch-version, because the incompatible use-cases > are not intended, undocumented and far less important than fixing > Remote-Code-Execution exploits on existing systems. > > > > [Commits](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.5.2...v4.5.3) > > ## v4.5.2 - November 13th, 2019 > # Bugfixes > > - fix: use String(field) in lookup when checking for "constructor" - d541378 > - test: add fluent API for testing Handlebars - c2ac79c > > Compatibility notes: > - no incompatibility are to be expected > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`c819c8b`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/c819c8b533934d2ac18001d7eb27a3205b00c2f3) v4.5.3 - [`827c9d0`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/827c9d0747bef7d7f89829779523b6b2dcf3051d) Update release notes - [`f7f05d7`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/f7f05d7558e674856686b62a00cde5758f3b7a08) fix: add "no-prototype-builtins" eslint-rule and fix all occurences - [`1988878`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/198887808780bbef9dba67a8af68ece091d5baa7) fix: add more properties required to be enumerable - [`886ba86`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/886ba86c2f9cc71b7d99b9018fbe2d72a57085cc) test/chore: add chai/expect and sinon to "runtime"-environment - [`0817dad`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/0817dad7e72c51d07f7700547d0c69aa79a4976b) test: add sinon as global variable to eslint in the specs - [`93516a0`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/93516a0b07026ebd23c84fddf270a0c8b570bc59) test: add sinon.js for spies, deprecate current assertions - [`93e284e`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/93e284ed9be1e38c5e6945f15af1ccd689f2ada6) chore: add chai and dirty-chai for better test assertions - [`c02b05f`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/c02b05fa819f46bb66c878bebc6e8006408ebd5c) fix: use !== 0 instead of != 0 - [`8de121d`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/8de121d21c88a6ab877e3a0eec9daaac483f3bf0) v4.5.2 - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.1.2...v4.5.3)

issue.title: Better gathering of Aragon DAOs based on token info
issue.body:
Fix #1 through consistently handling DAO token contracts. Do not rely on `token.controller()` heuristic anymore.

By the way, it makes loading Aragon DAOs faster by about 40% (from ~23s to ~13s).

issue.title: Less balance queries
issue.body:
Decrease amount of balance queries. Solution could involve:
- caching inside BalanceService,
- using a single BalanceService for the system.

issue.title: User Analytics
issue.body:
As a person related to development of the dashboard, I would like to have a data-enabled view over what people are doing with the dashboard. The dashboard is quite sensitive, so Google Analytics or something like this is not an option. Options I found:
- https://matomo.org
- https://github.com/Countly/countly-server

issue.title: If I own MKR, show me MakerDAO Governance Votes [REQ]
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

I own MKR tokens, which means that I am a participant in MakerDAO, and their governance processes for monetary policy.

If I load mydaodashboard, it does not show me information about MakerDAO's votes.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I would like to see MakerDAO in my list of DAOs on mydaodashboard

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

None.

**Additional context**

More details on MakerDAO's governance processes are here: https://vote.makerdao.com

issue.title: Don't load "Sealed Proposals" by default [REQ]
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

The page takes a long time to load all the "Sealed Proposals".

In many ways, this information is no longer so relevant for a participant, as they are unable to influence these decisions any more.

So, it seems a shame to slow them down from being able to see the things that they can influence.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Remove "Sealed Proposals" all together - those votes have passed. Also, they are accessible by going to the DAO's page itself.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

For the dashboard to only load "Active Proposals" by default, and then for there to be a button for a user to press to also load "Sealed Proposals" if they want to.

**Additional context**

The list of "Sealed Proposals" is going to get bigger and bigger and bigger, and this is going to mean that loading it is going to get slower and slower and slower :)

issue.title: Show Aragon Core Governance DAOs to holders of ANT [REQ]
issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

I hold ANT, but mydaodashboard.com does not show Aragon's Core Governance DAOs in the list of DAOs that I participate in.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

I would like it if mydaodashboard was able to show me all the DAOs that I am able to participate in, by virtue of me owning ANT.

Currently, if I am a holder of ANT, I am technically a member of all (currently 2) Aragon's core governance DAOs - i.e. the ones which govern how Aragon works, and how the funds raised during the ICO are allocated.

Specifically, if I own ANT, then I currently have the power to vote in these DAOs:

https://mainnet.aragon.org/#/governance.aragonproject.eth
https://mainnet.aragon.org/#/agp10

I would like for these DAOs (and any future DAOs which use ANT as voting tokens) to appear in My DAO Dashboard.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

I can continue to organically discover all the DAOs that my ownership of ANT allows me to participate in.

**Additional context**

More details here: https://aragon.org/project/governance/
